name: Angels Landing Cabernet Sauvignon
description: This Cabernet has it all. Ripe dark fruit, structure, balance and elegance. That's a rare combination that makes Angels Landing Cabernet one of our favorite Napa Cabs. Rich blackberry and cherry fruit, leads to notes of spice and chocolate and finishes with a touch of sweet oak. There's also a freshness here that just adds to its overall excellence and makes it a perfect Cabernet for pairing with food.

name: Angels Landing Merlot Napa
description: A rich mix of black fruit, hints of dark chocolate, spices, cassis, and toasty oak on the finish. A perfect companion to red meats, aged cheeses and salmon, or sushi grade tuna steaks

name: Antale Veneto Rosso
description: Producing every style of wine and with great success, the Veneto is one of the most multi-faceted wine destinations in Italy. The Antale has a deep ruby red color and flavors of plum and currants with a hint of cocoa on the soft and elegant finish. Pair it with a rich and over the top pasta, Cin Cin!

name: Baus Family Cabernet Sauvignon Private Reserve
description: A full-bodied and rich Cabernet, this wine is dark ruby in color, with lifted aromas of dark fruit, tobacco, vanilla and spice. Packed with intense flavors of black cherries, black plums and blackberries intermingled with complex notes of clove, cocoa and earth  on the palate. The fruit is beautifully balanced with a smooth, luxurious, oaky finish of sweet vanilla, spice and toast. Serve with grilled lamb chops or braised short ribs.

name: Bear Path Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc

name: Briar Hill Pinot Noir Santa Barbara County
description: Briar Hill wines pay homage to the briar-covered hillsides of chaparral that frame the vineyards of Santa Barbara County. Find rich notes of plum, black cherry, and bittersweet chocolate layered over silky tannins on this fine selections. Recommended with oven-baked salmon or mushroom & truffle pasta.

name: Bulliat Beaujolais Nouveau
description: A deep purple with subdued aromas of strawberry and banana typical of Nouveau.  In this case, they are restrained in the flavors as well, and the result is a Nouveau that tastes more like wine than candy.

name: Casa Dora Cava Brut NV
varietal: Sparkling, Macabeo, Parellada, Cava, Xarel Lo
description: Casa Dora Cava is crisp and refreshing with fine and elegant bubbles that gracefully frame the citrus, green apple and biscotti aromas and flavors. Enjoy with appetizers, fish, chicken, pork, or on its own. Also ideal for celebrations, mixed with orange juice for a mimosa, or mixed with cassis for a Kir Royal.

name: Delatour Chardonnay Cuvee Premier
description: Aromas of white flowers, almonds and exotic fruit with flavors of crisp apples and pears. Give it a slight chill and enjoy with roasted chicken, turkey, shellfish on the half shell, salmon and shrimp. Clean, pleasant and refreshing.

name: Domaine Bousquet Black Rock Malbec
description: The Black Rock Malbec from Domaine Bousquet is everything that one would want in an Argentinian Malbec. Featuring rich blackberry and cassis flavors with hints of black pepper and spice, this smooth, silky wine rolls across the palate and has a long, lingering finish. Red meats get ready, this is your perfect match!

name: Domaine De Verquiere Sablet Cotes du Rhone
Domaine Des Cotes Blanches Sancerre Rouge
Domaine Fondreche Ventoux Rose
description:
After a nocturnal harvest to avoid the heat and strong light, the grapes are pressed using a hyper-reductive system and without sulphites. They are then left to macerate with their deposits at a very low temperature for one week before fermentation.
Lastly the wine is aged on fine lees in a vat prior to bottling.

name: Domaine Girard Le Clef Du Recit Menetou Salon
Eighteen Eighty Three Chardonnay
description: Tropical fruits are bursting from the nose. Juicy fruit on the palate with ripe apples, guava and mango balanced by subtle oak, vanilla, and spice.

name: El Jamon Garnacha
description:
A fruit driven wine, offering opulent raspberry-strawberry flavors with hints of savory spices.  Soft and well-rounded tannins on the palate add structure to the juicy fruit finish.

100% Garnacha (Grenache) sourced from two bush trained, low yielding vineyards from different altitudes. The lower altitude vineyard adds structure and ripe fruit flavors.  The higher altitude vineyard (1,968 to 2,296 ft.) adds acidity and depth.  Manually harvested at peak ripeness to ensure soft and plush tannins. Cold macerated for 72 hours before fermentation.

name: El Jamon Tempranillo
description:
Bursting with ripe berry and plum fruit with savory undertones. Soft and round on the palate with easy tannins and lingering red fruit flavors.

Sourced from two trellised, low yielding vineyards from different altitudes. The lower altitude vineyard adds structure and ripe fruit flavors.  The higher altitude vineyard (1,968 to 2,296 ft.) adds acidity and depth.  Manually harvested at peak ripeness to ensure soft and plush tannins. Cold macerated for 72 hours before fermentation.

name: Essay Chenin Blanc South Africa
description: This is a medium-bodied white blend made primarily from South Africa's classic white variety, Chenin Blanc. Chenin Blanc is known for its generosity of fruit and friendliness towards most foods. This wine shows typical Chenin Blanc aromas of pineapple, lychee, and guava. A few months of lees contact enhances the texture of this wine, while still maintaining a fruity palate and fresh finish. The addition of Viognier and Roussanne adds complexity with each component contributing its distinctive characteristics to the blend, bringing out hints of pear, melon, and granadilla.

name: Fisch Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc
description: Sourced from premium Napa Valley vineyards, this bright, fresh Sauvignon Blanc exhibits ripe citrus and tropical fruits accentuated by vibrant acidity and long finish. Recently placed 1st in a blind tasting among highly acclaimed Napa producers!

name: Fog Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon
description: This wine, a deep garnet in the glass, opens with alluring aromas of dark red fruit. This luscious Cabernet Sauvignon presents rich flavors of dried plums, Medjool dates, red currants and bright berries flavours on the palate. The wine has soft, round tannins and a lingering finish.

name: Fog Mountain Chardonnay
description: Fog Mountain Chardonnay opens with aromas of juicy pear, green apple, and toasted almonds. This wine is bright on the palate with crisp acidity from tart fruits and citrus notes balanced by a hint of vanilla cream.

name: Fog Mountain Field Blend
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Sirah, Syrah, Zinfandel

name: Fog Mountain Pinot Noir
description: The fog and the mountain are integral to the terroir that creates fine wines. As stewards of the land, we understand the essential role the fog plays in cooling the vines and preserving their flavors over a long ripening period, while the slopes of the mountain offer the unique soil and climate ideally-suited for responsible farming and fine wines. This Pinot Noir opens with wonderful aromas of Bing cherry and strawberry as well as just a touch of delicate baking spice. Bright and light flavors of strawberry pie and brown sugar create an elegant, well balanced, and medium-bodied wine with a juicy finish.

name: Fog Mountain Sauvignon Blanc
description:
Fog Mountain’s California Sauvignon Blanc was produced from carefully selected grapes grown throughout California. This Sauvignon Blanc is a lively, elegant wine fermented 100% in stainless steel tanks to preserve freshness. Aromas of key lime, white peach, and guava jump from the glass. On the palate this bright and expressive wine is bursting with flavors of honeydew, tangerine, and fresh pineapple with a touch of honeysuckle. 

We recommend you try it with crab cakes or shrimp scampi pasta.

name: Go Figure Lot 49 Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Deep ruby color. Aromas of violets, black currants, black cherry jam, dark chocolate, black pepper, sweet oak, vanilla and charred wood. Full-bodied, ripe and chewy tannins with a long finish that keeps on going. Ripe dark fruit flavors of black cherry and black currants. Vanilla, cocoa powder, black pepper, cedar round out this mouth-filling Cab. Get it now, while it lasts!

name: Go Figure Lot 62 Cabernet Sauvignon
description: In 2016, Mother Nature treated the Napa Valley with a dream growing season to top off her superlative five vintage run. When the history books are written, this vintage will stand with the best.

name: Go Figure Lot 69 Marche Rosso IGT
Go Figure Lot 73 Chardonnay Sonoma Coast
description:
The Lot 73 Sonoma Coast Chardonnay is a pure expression of the California coastline because the fruit comes from a vineyard located within a stone’s throw of the Pacific.  Picture the Pacific coastline in a bottle: fresh lemon, lime, oyster shell, and rocks. 
 
This has a refreshing acidity, tremendous focus, and an incredibly long finish t

name: Go Figure Lot 74 Pinot Noir
description: The Lot 74 Russian River Valley Pinot Noir is a textbook example of what the region is about.  Ripe red fruit, balanced by savory spice and earthy minerality with rounded tannins and a long finish.

name: Go Figure Lot 75 Diamond Mountain Cabernet Sauvignon
Going Forward Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
description: Raspberry, red cherry and cocoa powder aromas give way to red fruit and berries, and a light earthy note on the palate.

name: Granite Hill Cabernet Sauvigon
description: 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cab Franc, 5% Merlot. Concentrated fruit flavors of dark cherry, toasted oak, black currants, raspberry with a long full finish. Vegan Friendly

name: Granite Hill Cellars Old Vine Zinfandel
description: 90% Zinfandel, 5% Petite Sirah, 5% Syrah. Aromas of blackberry jam, flavors of black cherries, strawberries, soft peppercorn and a sweet & smoky spice that finish long, flavorful and lingering. Vegan friendly.

name: Granite Hill Cellars Pinot Grigio
description: This Pinot Grigio displays exotic floral aromas that stream into some subtle green apple and citrus with a light spiciness. The finish is smooth and everlasting with ending notes of peaches.

name: Greetings From The Willamette Valley Pinot Noir
description: Greetings Willamette Valley Pinot Noir is a wine hand-crafted with an adventurous spirit. Marionberries, spice, dark cherries - grown & produced with the greatest respect for the earth. Lush and round, but this wine is for a winding road, so it’s curvy, elegant. Long finish. It has all the personality you’d want to compliment a journey... Enjoy!

name: Hat's Off Chardonnay (by Wente Vineyards)
description: This wine is made with grapes sourced from select vineyards in California and harvested at the optimum level of maturity. The grapes were gently pressed and fermented in a combination of new and used oak barrels and stainless-steel tanks. Fermentation was kept cold to ensure a slow process that retains the natural fruitiness of the grapes. Golden yellow in color, Hats Off Chardonnay is full of inviting vanilla and brown sugar aromatics. A touch of oak and cinnamon-kissed green apple flavors create a smooth Chardonnay with a soft, fruity finish.

name: I Veroni Chianti Rufina I Domi
Jacob Heims Old Vines Riesling Kabinett
La Ferme Du Mont Cotes du Rhone Villages
La Tonnelle Alpes De Haute Provence Rose
description: The Syrah in particular gives this wine its structure, color, and red berry aromas with hints of violet. In the glass, it is a salmon color. It possesses great intensity on the nose with hints of lemon and gooseberry. On the palate, it is supple in texture and easy to drink.

name: Long Path Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Displays pleasant aromas of bright red cherry and berries. On the palate, flavors of plum, raspberry and cherry are complemented with allspice, cinnamon and vanilla. It's medium-full bodied with a soft tannic structure. Try pairing with steak, but seasoned pork chops and pork tenderloin are also tasty options. Also pair with hard, aged cheeses before dinner.

name: Lornano Etel Rosato
description: Fattoria di Lornano is a member of the “Consorzio del Marchio Storico Chianti Classico Gallo Nero” since its foundation in 1924. Lornano practices a sustainable model of agriculture which promotes equilibrium with the environment and preserves natural resources.

name: Mado En Provence Rose
description: A blend of 50% Grenache, 40% Cinsault and 10% Syrah. Light pink color. Fine and pleasant nose with spring flower and lemon notes. A well-balanced and subtle wine with crushed strawberry and citrus fruit aromas.

name: Maidenhair Pinot Noir
description: A classic Willamette Valley Pinot Noir, Maidenhair is full of aromatic ripe red fruit and spice on the nose. When it flows over your palate it is well balanced with elegant tannins and fresh acidity carrying the lush red fruit through the finish.

name: Marlborough Vines Sauvignon Blanc
description: Fresh, powerful and zingy! The nose and palate are dominated by citrus flavors of grapefruit, lemons and limes with underlying pineapple flavors. Made from Sauvignon Blanc from the Marlborough region.

name: Montalbera Fuori Catalogo Piemonte Rosso
description: The wine is Intense and fruity, with scents of red fruits and apricot. Delicate, smooth and full-bodied, with scents of berry jam.

name: Natale Verga Chianti
description: Bright, fruity Sangiovese flavors of cherry, berry and spice are supple and easy to appreciate on both the nose and palate. Crisp acidity keeps the flavors lively and lengthy on the finish. Perfect for pizza or pasta.

name: Natale Verga Il Roccolo Pinot Grigio
Natale Verga Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: The aromatic red fruit nose leads to flavors of cherry, berry and spice with a middle palate of fresh strawberries, smoke and spice. Finish is soft, harmonic and full bodied.

name: No Curfew Cabernet Sauvignon
description:
Everyone either wants him or wants to BE him: The No Curfew Cab Sauv is one tall drink of water. (Well… wine). It’s that friend who catches every eye but likes to stay in the shadows. Polished but a little brooding, that Bruce Banner “you won’t like me when I’m angry” look that gets you weak in the knees. That mix of intense power but velvety softness, like a linebacker who tears up when he hears his best friends’ engagement story.

And at the end of the day, when you’re looking for pure class and a delicious Cabernet, this is a wine that checks all the boxes.

name: No Curfew Chardonnay
description: Aromas of green apple, pears, and melon which meld seamlessly with a hint of buttery oak. Excellent structure and a balanced acidity.

name: No Curfew Pinot Noir
description: This wine starts off with fruity aromas and flavors of dried cherries, cranberry sauce, raspberry jelly, and ground pepper. The palate is soft, fruity, medium-bodied and warming, with a medium-length finish imparting notes of milk chocolate truffle, root beer float, and black licorice with earthy tannins and moderate oak flavor.

name: Olema Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma County
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Petit Verdot, Petite Sirah, Merlot

name: Olema Rose Cotes De Provence
description: Made in the Côtes de Provence in the village of Vidauban, this wine is smooth and elegant, a lovely pale copper-salmon color in the glass.

name: Olema Sonoma County Pinot Noir
description: The wine starts with strong aromas of bright candied cherry, wild strawberry, pomegranate and plum with lite background notes of pine sap and fresh vanilla bean.

name: Perseverance Lodi Old Vine Zinfandel
description: Fruit forward with plenty of ripe plum, black cherry and spice flavors throughout. Concentrated on the palate with mocha spice, black raspberry and white pepper. Big and rich with classic Zinfandel bramble on the finish.

name: Pietre Del Sole Pinot Grigio
description: Fresh, clean, and driven with minerality, this Pinot Grigio supports a stable frame of fruit and texture on the mid palate not often found in similar bottlings.

name: Pin It Chardonnay
description:
A beautiful expression of Chardonnay, all from Wente's Estate Vineyards. Opens with gentle floral notes on the nose and showcases beautiful hints of creamy lemon curd, green apple and vanilla on the palate. Enticing minerality and fresh natural acidity on the pleasant finish. Estate grown in Certified Sustainable vineyards.
 
When you find something you love - places, experiences, hang outs, you Pin It! That's the same idea behind this wine.

name: Pleasures Pinot Noir
description: Delicate and fruit forward with pomegranate, strawberry, cherry and sweet spice flavors on the nose and palate. The wine ends with firm, ripe tannins, lively acidity and a touch of complex spiciness.

name: Punch Cabernet Sauvignon Red Hills Lake County
Robert Goulley Chablis
description: Organically grown Chardonnay reaches the peak of freshness here in the hills of Burgundy’s Chablis. The bedrock of fine grained chalk, formed many years ago from ancient oyster shells, gives these wines a streak of fresh acidity and minerality. Organic viticulture only enhances these flavors in the resulting wine.

name: Second Growth Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Medium to deep garnet-purple in color with a nose of cassis, blackcurrant, plums, baking chocolate, leather and a whiff of pencil shavings. It’s full-bodied with lush black fruit in the mouth framed by herbal notes and spice, with very fine tannins and good acidity to lift the concentrated finish. Very classic style of Cabernet Sauvignon and a great value.

name: Second Growth Pinot Noir Chehalem Mountains
description: Aromatic with bright red cherry and cola candy, the palate is pleasant and super easy drinking. An every day quaffable wine.

name: Second Growth Willamette Pinot Gris
description: Opens with green apple and papaya alongside breezy aromas of fresh meadow. This wine is exuberant on the palate with nectarine and melon, flourishes of lychee and a lingering pink-peppercorn finish. All wines from this boutique producer are produced with estate grown, biodynamically  farmed grapes.  Only 336cs produced.

name: Second Growth Willamette Pinot Noir
description: This Pinot Noir is dark and rich, leading with red cherry, plum, black tea and raspberry. The wine finishes with bright red fruit, spice and vanilla. All the wines from this boutique producer are made from estate grown, biodynamically farmed grapes. Only 700 cases produced.

name: Second Growth Willamette Valley Rose
description: Let your senses be taken away by pineapple, guava, sea breeze, married with white flowers and fresh cut strawberries. Expect a broad and juicy structure on the palate with crisp vibrancy and a dry finish.

name: Serra Da Estrela Albarino
description:
Straw yellow in color with hints of green.  On you nose you will find hints of apricot, pear complimented by a lemon-lime vibrancy.  The palate shows fresh acidity, with citrus, mineral and briny notes.  

A perfect pairing for any shellfish dish.

name: Shortbread Cellars Chardonnay
description:
Like the cookie of the same name, Shortbread wine is light, buttery, and simply delightful. Treat yourself any day of the week!

VINEYARD INFO/REGION
We selected grapes from across California’s best cool climate growing regions—from California’s North Coast to the Delta Region of the Sacramento River. With warm sunny days moderated by marine influences, conditions in these areas create an ideal climate for growing Chardonnay. Grapes harvested from a variety of regions are able to provide unique flavor components that together create a balanced, complex and harmonious wine.

TASTING NOTES
Tropical piña colada-esque notes of creamy coconut, pineapple, key lime and pink guava anchored by vanilla and toasted oak create a creamy mouthfeel and smooth finish. A perfect mate to grilled halibut with mango salsa or fresh ricotta drizzled with honey.

name: Stephen Goff Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir
description: "While the 2015 vintage was once of the most delicate renditions of Weber I have ever produced, 2016 is by far the darkest and most intense wine I have ever made from this site. While big by Weber standards this wine still brings all of the elegance, nuance and finesse that fans of this site have come to love and enjoy. The higher toned aromatics and lithe structure are all there coupled with a more robust and opulent dark red fruit profile. The best Weber I have produced to date."

name: Summer Sip Vin De France Rose
description: Bring on summer ... and rosé. Our favorite easy-drinking wine is the perfect way to celebrate sunshine and good times. We're sharing our go- to summer sips: enjoy it all with friends!

name: Tardieu Laurent Rasteau Vielles Vignes
description: Tardieu Laurent consistently sources and produces top notch Rhone wines and the Rasteau is no exception. Ripe, dark fruited and powerful, this Grenache based blend is sure to please.

name: Terra Santa Ile De Beaute Blanc
Terra Santa Ile De Beaute Rose
The Culprit Red Blend
varietal: Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc
description: You will be hard-pressed to resist this gem of a red blend. Displays intense aromas of fresh, ripe raspberries and toasty vanilla oak. Flavors of blackberry jam and deep, dark chocolate are framed by a velvety style. This fruit-forward, palate-pleasing wine finishes long, lingering , and smooth.

name: Vega Moragona Tempranillo La Duna Single Vineyard
Wheat Ridge Cellars Bourbon Barrel Aged Red Blend
description:
Fields of wheat and corn shimmer like fireflies under golden sunbeams across the Midwestern US. This is the heart of bourbon country. Nearly 2,000 miles away, vineyards stretch across the rolling hills of some of California’s most premier wine regions. Wheatridge Cellars seeks to bring these places together in one bottle through aging in bourbon barrels.

VINEYARD INFO/REGION
For this wine, we source grapes from California’s best growing regions. The climate is generally Mediterranean, though regions closer to the Pacific Ocean benefit from cool breezes. The 2017 vintage brought a close to the multiyear drought—filling reservoirs and bringing new life to cover crops, and then to the vines. Lots are selected to blend the characteristics from these varied regions.

WINEMAKING/VITICULTURE
From all across California, our winemaking team hand selects several grape varieties to use in our premium Red Blend. A portion of this wine then goes into used bourbon barrels, which impart the warm, caramel and coffee flavors of fine bourbon. Final blending helps to integrate both flavor profiles, creating a complex, multilayered wine.

TASTING NOTES
For this wine, traditional aromas of both premium red wine and bourbon mingle in the glass - black cherry, raspberry, molasses, and charred vanilla invite you in for a sip. On the palate, rich notes of black cherry and blackberry layer over brown sugar, coffee, and caramel.

FOOD PAIRING: Summer vegetable ratatouille or barbecue glazed beef short ribs.

name: 25 Days Red Blend
description:
On June 14, 1846, a revolt against Mexico claimed Sonoma County as an independent Republic of California for 25 days, marked by the now-famous Bear Flag. This strength, passion, and commitment was a precursor to the modern day Sonoma County, a place we are proud to call home. Our wines are a reflection of these values.

TASTING NOTES: Plush plum and black cherry on the nose are flanked by more dark fruits and dried herbs on the palate—think oregano and thyme. Graphite on the back palate leads to a finish marked with good acidity and length. Pair with a wild mushroom and thyme flatbread or heartier dishes like short ribs and burgers.

name: A Tout de Suite Pinot Noir Grochau Cellars
description: This wine is all about the bright fresh purity of Willamette Valley Pinot Noir! Our first release Pinot Noir each year is a blend from multiple Willamette Valley vineyards that capture the essence of each vintage. It’s a wine for every occasion from a family dinner to relaxing in front of the TV. Take it to the beach, the mountains, the office party or along on a bike ride (not encouraging, just saying). This is your anytime go-to bottle. Drink up!

name: Aiken Cabernet Sauvignon Oakville
description: Aiken Wines is Joel’s new project with his inaugural vintage of 2009. His Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon is 100% organically farmed Cabernet from Oakville Ranch near Dalle Valle and Stagecoach. The wine can be enjoyed in its youth but some bottle aging is allowing this wine to show its real heart.

name: Amici Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc
description: The Amici Appellation wines are made to capture the essence of its unique viticultural area through flagship bottlings and delicious flavor profiles.  Our family-owned winery is nestled in the foothills of the Palisades, just outside Calistoga, Napa Valley, where we are dedicated to producing true-to-varietal wines from exceptional vineyard sources.

name: Amici Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve
description: This 2018 Amici Cellars Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon highlights the lush, ripe fruit and Rutherford Dust of valley floor vineyards along with the structure and ageability of Napa Valley’s best mountain appellations. Aromas of blackberry, black currant and blueberry compote give way to notes of cedar box, soy, and currant. The palate is dense and viscous with laser-like precision. Richly fruit-forward with black raspberry, black plum and blackberry cobbler, the wine is also layered with spice, from savory herbs to vanilla and hazelnut. A long, fruit-driven finish leaves you wanting another sip.

name: Amici Cellars Pinot Noir Russian River Valley
Amici Cellars Sonoma Coast Chardonnay
description: The 2016 Amici Cellars Chardonnay Sonoma Coast is a classic Chardonnay with aromatic complexity and a fine balance of richness with delicate acidity. Enticing crisp apple, Bartlett pear, lemon lime, and hazelnut aromas on this wine lead to a rich meyer lemon, and lemon oil flavor on the palate and a long mineral finish. It is richly textured with a subtle hint of butter to contrast its crisp, clean finish.

name: Amuse Bouche Red Blend
description: Winemaker Heidi Barrett explains, "We have created Amuse Bouche, a limited edition, superb Pomerol style wine with the added value of limited edition art that is available to consumers through a variety of channels."

name: Andre Chemin Brut Champagne
description: A beautiful blanc des noirs from sustainably farmed vineyards. It's rich and expressive with notes of baked apple pie, brioche, and lemon curd with a toasty palate driven by persistent fine bubbles and a lengthy finish.

name: Andre Chemin Brut Rose Champagne NV
description: The Andre Chemin rose is a beautiful Champagne made from hand harvested sustainable grapes. It is beautiful and expressive of red berry and brioche with a refreshing minerality and expansive palate driven by fine bubbles.

name: Angels Landing Meritage Reserve
description: Lush aromas of plum, blackberry and dried herbs with a touch of vanilla and mocha. Rich and smooth with delicious dark berry flavors, hints of cedar and dark chocolate. Soft tannins and a lingering finish.

name: Bodegas Langa Real De Aragon Centenarias
Boisset Auxey Duresses 1er Cru Climat Du Val
Briar Hill Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
description: 100% Chardonnay from Santa Barbara County in California's Central Coast. Barrel-aged and displaying lovely ripe apple, delicious pear, and toasty vanilla with just the right amount of mouth-watering acidity to create a perfect balance. Ideal with everything from zucchini and goat cheese flatbread to seared sea scallops with lemon and capers.

name: Camile Giroud Bourgogne Blanc
description: "Regional Appellations are wines that can be made out of a blend of several locations, recognized within the appellation area. Wine merchant-maturer is a special profession, involving the careful selection of the best parcels for wine making, according to the vintage.In that which concerns our Bourgogne Blanc, we have selected parcels in Clos de la Combe in Puligny-Montrachet, in the village of Corpeau, neighboring that of Puligny-Montrachet, within Côte de Beaune and the Maconnais area."--Winery

name: Carl Sittmann Riesling
description: Carl Sittmann Riesling has aromas of green apples, pears, and apricots. The sweet flavors of peaches and apples are gracefully balanced by the crisp acidity keeping it refreshingly elegant and gracefully without being too sweet.

name: Cave Liberal Sparkling Rose
description: A great sparkler from Provence!  Aromas of freshly picked strawberries & honeysuckle abound. Dry, crisp & refreshing with a nice raspberry/guava finish. Crafted using the same production method as Prosecco (aka Tank Method or Charmat Method). A wonderful alternative to Prosecco! Easy-drinking & refreshing.

name: Chante Pierre Pays Du Gard Rose
Charles Sparr Gewurztraminer
description: Full-bodied and generous, it develops complex aromas of exotic fruits, flowers or spices. Powerful, exuberant, all round. The perfect wine for aperitif and cheeses.

name: Charles Sparr Pinot Blanc Tradition
description: A complex nose with fruity flowers and citrus.  The wine is well bodied with a beautiful length and clean finish.  Perfect with aperitif, shellfish, chicken, pork and cheese.

name: Chateau Cavalier Provence Rose Cascadel
description: A blend of Grenache, Syrah, Rolle, Cabernet-Sauvignon, Sémillon, Clairette, and Mourvèdre. This opulent blend is an expressive pairing for a wide variety of cuisines.

name: Chateau Matayac Cahors Malbec
description: This Cahors is a celebration of the old world of Malbec. Stuffed with stewed plums, ripe raspberry, and blueberry balanced with moderate acidity and an earthy bass note.

name: Chateau St. Michel
varietal: Semillon Blend, Semillon, Sauvignon Blanc, Muscadelle

name: Chateau Trians Varois En Provence Rose
Devaux Champagne Grande Reserve Brut
description: Champagne Devaux is hands down one of the top producers in the Cote des Bar. This Grand Reserve Brut is rich with white flower, peach and apricot with subtle biscuit tones and a palate that goes on and on.

name: Devaux Cuvee Rose Brut
varietal: Sparkling, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Champagne, Celebrate, Celebration, Gift
description:
Champagne DEVAUX is a well-established brand since 1846 and today the most prestigious house from the charismatic Pinot Noir region called “Côte des Bar” situated in the southern part of Champagne on the edge of the Burgundy region. This very exclusive Champagne House is known for its lovely complex and elegant style, due to a high proportion of reserve wines, with a delicate and soft mousse. All DEVAUX Champagnes NV are 3 to 5 years bottle aged so very food friendly.

APPELLATION
Champagne, France

VARIETAL COMPOSITION
80% Pinot Noir, 20% Chardonnay

WINEMAKING
The Cuvée Rosée is a blend of Pinot Noir 80% (including 10% of red wine and 5% skin contact rosé juice from selected vineyards) and Chardonnay 20%. First pressing juice only with 20% reserve wines partially aged in large oak casks. Aged 3 years on lees and an extra 3 to 6 months after dosage.

TASTING NOTES
Nose: Soft and ripe raspberries followed by aniseed notes.
Palate: A lovely fresh and smooth mousse with a good balance and violet notes on the finish.

name: Domaine Curry Cabernet Sauvignon
description: The Domaine Curry Cabernet Sauvignon is a big, bold wine with an expressive core of dark cherry fruit with underlying mocha and spice notes. Delicious velvety tannins fill the mouth, with a persistent finish. Drink now or age in your cellar for years to come.

name: Domaine Des Farondes Bourgogne Pinot Noir
Domaine Du Vieil Orme Touraine Sauvignon
description: Domaine du Vieil Orme makes a Sauvignon Blanc that is a dead ringer for a Sancerre. Crisp and pure with lemon, lime and melon flavors, this crowd-pleasing wine is one of our favorite value whites.

name: Domaine Fondreche Ventoux Rouge
description: Moving to the classic cuvee of the estate, the 2016 Ventoux Domaine checks in as 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre that will spend 18 months in a mix of stainless steel and tank. It offers a beautifully complex bouquet of black raspberries, candied violets, cedary spice and potpourri. Medium to full-bodied, seamless, incredibly polished and elegant, I suspect it’s the finest Domaine release to date.

name: Domaine La Clef du Recit Sancerre
description: Domaine La Clef du Récit is the exciting brand behind young and ambitious winemaker Anthony Girard. Fine acidity and an enduring minerality are great companions in displaying the beautiful purity of this wine. Carried by zesty, bright yellow and citrus fruit characters, it manages the split between a light, refreshing Sancerre with a somewhat juicy mid-palate weight and a wonderful lingering finish far too easily!

name: Domaine Verquiere Cotes du Rhone
description: With a beautiful, deep red colour, in full transition between its youthful aromas and those of ageing, it is a charming, fruity, well-balanced wine, full of power and not lacking in elegance

name: Domaine Vieil Orme Touraine Chenonceaux Sauvignon Blanc
Domaine des Cotes Blanches Sancerre Rose
Domaine du Vieil Orme Gabriel Cremant Brut
Don Tomasi Cabernet Sauvignon Nero d'Avola Cabernet Sauvignon
El Circo Volatinero Tempranillo
description:
Medium depth with a violet color. Fragrant aromas of cherries and blackberries, licorice and toffee. Medium body with a mild sensation of blackberries and cinnamon.
A perfect match for grilled sausages, lamb, roasted chicken, pizzas and pastas.

name: Favia Cabernet Sauvignon Coombsville
description: The 2016 vintage of their Coombsville Cabernet Sauvignon possesses a remarkably pure Cabernet Sauvignon character, with notes of cassis, black tea, cocoa nibs, leather and bay laurel.

name: Fog Mountain Merlot
description: The Fog Mountain Merlot was produced from carefully selected Merlot grapes grown throughout California. This Merlot is dark ruby in color with aromas reminiscent of raspberry jam with hints of lightly toasted oak. This wine is made in a fruit forward style exhibiting mouth filling black cherry, dusty chocolate, and just a touch of blackberry, finishing soft with ripe plum and delicate vanilla oak flavors.

name: Go Figure Lot 56 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
Go Figure Lot 68 Pinot Noir Willamette
Go Figure Lot 71 Atlas Peak Cabernet Sauvignon
Go Figure Lot 77 Montepulciano Vigne Vecchie
Going Forward North Coast Cabernet Sauvignon
Going Forward Red Blend Sonoma County
Grand Finale Whitehall Lane
description: The Grand Finale idea came to fruition when, after winning one of the Barrel Lots, Gary approached the winemaker to see if they would be willing to add a bit of wine from another of their most favorite barrels to the leftover Barrel Lot and bottle a few cases for us under the “Grand Finale” label. The final products are representative of the finest wine from the winemakers and a taste of what Premier Napa Valley wines are all about.. AND at a mere fraction of the cost!

name: Granite Hill Pinot Noir
description: The 2017 vintage is rich with flavors of black cherries, cranberries, cloves, tobacco with a touch of caramel and vanilla. The fruit forward style finishes lush and full.

name: Greetings From Willamette Valley Pinot Gris
description: This Willamette Valley Pinot Gris is not a simple wine. It is vibrant, clean, and well-balanced with notes of soft peach, melon, and citrus.

name: Greetings From Willamette Valley Rose
description: Greetings Rose from the Willamette Valley is flawlessly layered with soft berries, hints of creativity, spontaneity, lush mid-palate texture, unexpected and exciting subtle layers of confidence and a bring crisp finish.

name: Gris Marin Rose Sable De Camargue
Guillaume Gonnet Cotes du Rhone Rose
description: Their rosé “Le Rêveur” is equal parts Organically farmed Grenache and Cinsault which are fully destemmed and fermented in stainless steel with the natural yeasts present in the vineyard. After six months of aging in tank, the wine is perfectly dry and ready for summer!

name: Henri Abele Brut Rose
description: The aromas carry over onto the palate, which is smooth with all the fruitiness and finesse one would hope for in pink Champagne. Roasted notes on the aftertaste, with just the right amount of dosage. Perfect for the aperitif or with a first course.

name: Huge Bear Chardonnay
description: The 2017 Huge Bear Chardonnay is a lovely introduction to the vintage. It strikes a remarkable balance between the bold assertive flavors of the vintage and the delicate, delineated flavors of cool climate Chardonnay. Aromas of lemon peel, lemon curd and macadamia nut are framed by a suggestion of French oak. A lively palate filled with citrus peel, freshly baked pastry, and minerality give the wine energy and lift that persists well into the finish.

name: Huge Bear Chardonnay 1.5l
description: The 2017 Huge Bear Chardonnay is a lovely introduction to the vintage. It strikes a remarkable balance between the bold assertive flavors of the vintage and the delicate, delineated flavors of cool climate Chardonnay. Aromas of lemon peel, lemon curd and macadamia nut are framed by a suggestion of French oak. A lively palate filled with citrus peel, freshly baked pastry, and minerality give the wine energy and lift that persists well into the finish.

name: I Veroni Vin Santo Del Chianti Rufina
region: Vin Santo Del Chianti Ruffina Occhio Di Pernice Doc

name: Jean-Claude Boisset Nuits St Georges Les Charbonnieres
Jean-Paul Picard Sancerre Blanc
description: White Sancerre is a dry, fruity wine, made from Sauvignon Blanc, harvested from limestone-clay soils. On the nose it shows superb aromas of citrus fruits, allied to a touch of minerality. Serve at 10°, it is ideal with fish, shellfish, seafood, goat's cheese, or simply as an aperitif.

name: Juslyn Cabernet Sauvignon Perrys Blend
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot

name: Knights Bridge Pont De Chevalier Sauvignon Blanc
Kon Tiki Sauvignon Blanc
description: In 1947 the Kon Tiki made the incredible journey from Chile, sailing across the Pacific Ocean to the Polynesian Islands – paying homage to the Incan god Varacocha and the people of Chile. Inspired by this epic pilgrimage, Koa Tiki have worked to find the very best that Chile has to offer.

name: La Ferme Du Mont Cotes du Rhone Premiere
description: "The Côtes du Rhône Premiere Côte, which is based on 60% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre, its deep ruby/purple color is followed by terrific notes of blueberries, strawberries, spring flowers and hints of garrigue. Drink this soft, medium-bodied, totally charming Côtes du Rhône on release and over the following 3-4 years." 88-90 points - Robert Parker

name: La Magdalena Bobal de los 60s
description: This is 100% Bobal from Spain. Earthy notes of cedar, blackberries and mocha. Gorgeous!

name: La Riviera Coteaux Varois En Provence Rose
description: Everything begins in 1980 when François Devictor decides to settle down in Provence to produce great wines. He falls in love at first sight with the Domaine de la Sanglière in Bormes les Mimosas and sees the potential which this idyllic site represents.

name: Lalie Rose
description: The selection of Rosés may seem endless so we will help you choose. One of our favorite Provence Rosé is Lalie. This is a textbook Provencal Rosé with lovely flavors of white cherry and nectarine and hints of citrus on the crisp finish. It is the partner to everything from a dozen on the half shell and roasted herbs de Provence chicken to a grilled flatbread with goat cheese, caramelized onions and porcini mushrooms.

name: Les Andides Cremant De Loire
varietal: Sparkling, Chenin Blanc, Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc, Champagne
description: Pale yellow colour. Elegant and regular bead. Complex nose, combining the freshness and the typical floral bouquet of Chenin blanc, the fruity aromas of Chardonnay and Cabernet franc. Lively initial impression on the palate, with a rounded structure, and an elegant follow-through. Lovely, long aftertaste, with hints of fresh fruit (pears, peaches).

name: Les Andides Cremant de Loire Rose Brut
description: Lovely pink colour with brilliant highlights. Elegant and regular bead. Subtle nose, combining the freshness and fruity bouquet of Cabernet franc (red berries, strawberry, cherry). Lively initial impression on the palate, with a well-balanced structure, and an elegant follow-through. Lovely and persistent aftertaste.

name: Les Quatre Tours Esprit Sud Provence Rose
Long Path Chardonnay
description:
If you love a great Chardonnay value, then the Long Path is the path to take! Fresh flavors of apple and citrus are touched with light buttery notes and subtle oak. 
Dry and amazing!

name: Loubadere Cote de Gascogne
varietal: Sauvignon Blanc, Colombard, Ugni Blanc, Gros Manseng

name: Malesan Brut Rose Cremant de Bordeaux
Matahiwi Estate Mt Hector Pinot Noir
Natale Verga Barbera d'Asti
description: This opens with red-skinned berry, blue flower and clove aromas. The racy, straightforward palate offers bountiful cassis, orange zest and ground pepper flavors alongside smooth tannins. Made in the more modern style, clean and refreshing with light, silky tannins. Very well-balanced with fresh acidity.

name: Natale Verga Barolo
description: 100% Nebbiolo. Produced from a selection of grapes grown in the most prestigious vineyards of Barolo, this particular wine is a unique combination of strength and elegance. Opulent blackberry and rose fruit on the palate with pleasant spicy and woody notes blending perfectly with the full, elegant flavor and the robust body. Minerally on the long finish.

name: Natale Verga Chianti Classico Riserva
description: Deep in its garnet red color, the nose is alive with blackberry jam, black pepper, and sweet tobacco. The dark cherry and blue fruit shine through with a long and satisfying finish. Well balanced with the fruit to wood relationship, both complimenting each other. Perfect with a good cut of beef, game, turkey chili, and lamb shanks with mushroom risotto.

name: Natale Verga Gavi
description: From Piedmont in northern Italy, this dry, delicate white offers nice floral aromas with pear, honey and citrus flavors enhanced by its minerality.

name: Natale Verga Love Red Blend
description: Red wine with a unique personality! A blend of 60% Corvina and 40% Merlot grapes. An intense ruby red color with a rich bouquet of ripe fruit, coffee, and cocoa. Full-bodied and soft with elegant tannins. Pairs well with rich, savory dishes and perfect as an after dinner wine.

name: Natale Verga Moscato D'asti
description: Slightly sweet and frizzy with flavors of peaches and honeydew melon. A delight with pound cake or chocolate truffles

name: Natale Verga Nero d'Avola
description: Vibrant flavors of dark cherry, plum and raspberry are layered with notes of baking spices and loam. Medium weight and easy to drink. A wonderful, affordable wine with good structure and depth and a lush finish.

name: Ocaso 2016 Torrontes
description: Aromatic nose of flowers and apple peel aromas with a rich, complex, pineapple character and a fleshy texture. The palate follows with apple, pear and pie crust flavors.  Bright, saline, mineral finish; barely off-dry, lush, and long. Great with cheeses, fresh fruit and seafood.

name: Ocaso Sparkling Malbec Rose Extra Brut
description:
Argentina's best sparkling rose wines are made from Malbec, like this example from Ocaso. Nice and dry, with a bit more flavor and zestiness than you average sparkling in this price range. Pairs great with salty foods!

A fun, affordable sparkling rosé from Ocaso. Pours a pale beautiful salmon color, with aromas of apple and pear skin up front. More apple skin on the palate, with delightful notes of red fruits and watermelon candy to balance the refreshingly dry finish.

name: Oops Voluptuous Beauty Cabernet Franc Carmenere
Paula Kornell Brut
description:
This perfect introduction to Paula Kornell’s sparkling wines has all the elegance, refinement,and freshness that one would expect from the best bubbles. Its racy acidity makes the wine lively and refreshing, while the small amount of residual sugar gives the wine weight and depth alongside the aromas of lemon pith, fresh peaches, just-ripe apricots, toast, acacia, and honeysuckle.  

Ideal for a Sunday afternoon in the garden, a weekend picnic, or at the beginning of a meal, this approachable and highly drinkable wine will satisfy all tastes.

Blend: 80% Chardonnay, 20% Pinot Noir

Fruit for this wine comes from certified sustainable vineyards in some of the coolest growing regions around California. The vineyards are managed by fifth-generation grape growers, and were awarded the California Green Medal Award for Sustainable Winegrowing in Business.

MÉTHODE CHAMPENOISE

name: Pezzi King Dry Creek Zinfandel Sonoma County
description: 100% Zinfandel.  This elegant blend of the finest Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel boasts strawberry, allspice and vanilla aromas on the nose. Subtle caramel blends with the tart cranberry in this medium bodied Zinfandel creating a burst of flavor across the palate. The balanced acidity and bold tannins accentuate notes of mission fig, black currant and clove on the complex finish.

name: Pin It Pinot Noir
description:
A beautiful expression of Pinot Noir, all from Wente's Estate Vineyards. A fruit-driven red, with bright and luscious flavors of cranberry and red cherry. A food-friendly wine, this Pinot Noir has layered complexity, medium weight on the palate, and a smooth, lingering finish. Produced from a  selection of fruit forward Pinot Noir clones grown in Certified Sustainable Vineyards.
 
When you find something you love - places, experiences, hang outs, you Pin It! That's the same idea behind this wine.

name: Pleasures Chardonnay
description: Buttery barrel fermented flavors of apples, oranges and tropical fruit with a touch of honey and cloves. Balanced on the palate with yummy flavors of ripe apples, peaches and nectarines. Delightfully mellow with a mouthfeel that is creamy and soft.

name: Prospect & Main Cabernet Sauvignon
description:
At Prospect & Main, we seek out the best grapes California has to offer.

Vintage
The vines were rejuvenated from winter rains allowing the 2017 growing season to thrive during spring and summer. A severe heat wave prior to harvest reduced the overall crop yield, giving the remaining Cabernet grapes extended hang time to develop deep color, good extraction and full flavor.

Winemaking
The grapes for our Prospect & Main Cabernet Sauvignon reflect all that defines the diverse and distinct growing regions in California. Blending the finest fruit from warm and cool vineyard sites create a wine embodying the state’s rich terroir of ripe flavors, balanced acidity and fine tannins.

Tasting Notes
Aromas of blackberry, warm baking spices and dark cacao on the nose. Rich plum and black cherry on the palate partner with the balanced acidity and fine tannins for a complex and delightful wine. Pair with a cheesy meat lasagna or Point Reyes Original Blue cheese.

name: Rancho Costero Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
description:
Spanish for “coastal ranch,” Rancho Costero wines are an embodiment of Paso Robles. This historic growing region boasts an ideal micro-climate for producing premium quality grapes with unmistakable terroir.

VINEYARD INFO/REGION
Paso Robles has been a wine-growing region since 1797. As it grew into a more premium region in the 1950s and 60s, Cabernet Sauvignon became one of the top varietals. With a long growing season consisting of plenty of sunshine and Pacific breezes, Paso Robles is an ideal location for producing high quality Cab.

WINEMAKING/VITICULTURE
Across the Paso region, vintners rejoiced over the success of the growing season. A wet winter fed the reservoirs and enabled healthy cover crops to regenerate the soils. Even temperatures allowed for the desired ripening of Cabernet grapes with a slightly earlier than average harvest.

TASTING NOTES
This wine is full-bodied with generous flavors of cassis, crushed red berries, and dried herbs. The finish is soft and juicy, showing a hint of toasty oak and vanilla.

FOOD PAIRING: With its bold, full-body, this wine pairs great with BBQ and Carnitas tacos.

name: Rancho Costero Zinfandel Paso Robles
description: Rancho Costero hails from California's Paso Robles region and displays many of the characteristics of Zinfandels from that area. Ripe cherry and blackberry fruit lead the way, with herb and dark chocolate notes making appearances in this juicy Zin. If you're grilling anything with BBQ sauce, from chicken wings to baby back ribs, this is an ideal pairing.

name: Robert Goulley Bourgogne Blanc
description: This wine expresses scents of white flowers, almonds, and toast. In the mouth, this wine has great minerality that brings out the character of the soil the grapes were grown in. Finishes nicely with flavors of honey.

name: Rose City Pinot Noir
description: The nose is driven by a combination of ripe fresh fruits of strawberry, raspberry, and pomegranate. The ripe red cherry drives the proﬁle and balances the mineral, herb, and ﬂoral scents. The palate is loaded with vibrant red cherry and fresh strawberry fruit ﬂavors. Slightly candied in style, but with fresh acidity and delicate detail. The body is medium weight with a silky texture and long ﬁnish. The palate is deﬁnitely anchored by the ripe red cherry and sundried strawberry, yet offers a pleasant equilibrium with the earth notes of dried sage. The oak spice markers echo the nose and gently add complexity to the overall taste.

name: Rougeot Bourgogne Blanc Grandes Gouttes
description:
Organic.  100% Chardonnay.  The lieu-dit “Les Grandes Gouttes” sits at the southern edge of Meursault on border with Pugligny, just a few hundred meters below the Premier Cru vineyard Les Charmes.  The vineyard is only a hectare size and the vines were planted between 1950 – 1980 on clay-limestone soils.  Hand-harvested, direct pressing in whole bunches untrimmed, and cold settling for 2 days.  Alcoholic fermentation with natural yeasts begins in a concrete vat and then pumped into French oak barrels to undergo malolactic fermentation (5% new oak).  Aging in oak barrels for 12 months.   

"In the center of Meursault village, Pierre-Henri Rougeot has been quietly producing impeccable minimal intervention, low-sulfur wines since he returned to the family domaine in 2010. The 18th century stone cellar was originally built for the Hospices de Beaune to press the fruit from the adjacent orchards, and was purchased Pierre-Henri’s great-great-grandfather in the 19th century. Today the orchards have been transformed into an elegant garden and stamp-sized monopole vineyard, and the cellar has been renovated to comfortably hold two vintages from Rougeot’s 13 hectares of vines in and around Meursault.

Pierre-Henri’s experience travelling throughout France gives him a unique vision that hews strongly to Burgundian tradition with a soft touch inspired by the vins natures made by his friends in Saumur, Cahors, and beyond. Today, the Rougeot vineyards are farmed organically, and Pierre-Henri’s no sulfur vinification effortlessly balances a natural wine approach with traditional Burgundian technique to create wines with energy and balance. Each terroir from Aligoté and Passetoutgrain through Premier Crus is bottled as a single-vineyard designate. The wines are energetic, precise, and delicious. It’s simply astounding that the domaine has maintained a quiet profile while producing such compelling wines. It will be even more astounding if that continues."

name: Rougeot Bourgogne Passetoutgrain Les Vercheres
description:
Organic.  60% Pinot Noir and 40% Gamay.  Both grapes are sourced from “Les Vercheres” harvested at the same time and co-fermented to produce this Passetoutgrain.  The vines range from 40 to 70-year-old (planted in 1950s and 1980s) and grown on clay-limestone soils.  Hand-harvested and vinified 100& whole cluster with natural yeast and no sulfur during vinification or elevage.  Fermentation occurs in concrete tanks with 15-18 days maceration and 1-2 pump overs per day.  Aging in oak barrels for 12 months on the fine lees.  No sulfites added. 

"In the center of Meursault village, Pierre-Henri Rougeot has been quietly producing impeccable minimal intervention, low-sulfur wines since he returned to the family domaine in 2010. The 18th century stone cellar was originally built for the Hospices de Beaune to press the fruit from the adjacent orchards, and was purchased Pierre-Henri’s great-great-grandfather in the 19th century. Today the orchards have been transformed into an elegant garden and stamp-sized monopole vineyard, and the cellar has been renovated to comfortably hold two vintages from Rougeot’s 13 hectares of vines in and around Meursault.

Pierre-Henri’s experience travelling throughout France gives him a unique vision that hews strongly to Burgundian tradition with a soft touch inspired by the vins natures made by his friends in Saumur, Cahors, and beyond. Today, the Rougeot vineyards are farmed organically, and Pierre-Henri’s no sulfur vinification effortlessly balances a natural wine approach with traditional Burgundian technique to create wines with energy and balance. Each terroir from Aligoté and Passetoutgrain through Premier Crus is bottled as a single-vineyard designate. The wines are energetic, precise, and delicious. It’s simply astounding that the domaine has maintained a quiet profile while producing such compelling wines. It will be even more astounding if that continues."

name: Serbolino Il Picchio Brunello Di Montalcino
description: Intense ruby color, supple and concentrated on the palate with an incredibly long and complex finish classically representative of Brunello. Four years of aging in Slavonian oak and rested in bottle for another 4-6 months.

name: Serbolino Il Picchio Brunello Di Montalcino Riserva
Serbolino Il Picchio Rosso Di Montalcino
Shell And Shale Cabernet Paso Robles
description: Shell & Shale Cabernet Sauvignon offers just what we like in Paso Cabs. Concentrated, ripe and juicy with red cherry, blackberry, and plum fruit, the mellow tannins here make this very drinkable on its own, but will also work wonderfully with a steak.

name: Sojourn Oakville Cabernet Sauvignon
description:
Based in the town of Sonoma, Sojourn Cellars is a highly acclaimed winery specializing in the production of artisan Pinot noir and Cabernet Sauvignon wines.

We source fruit from celebrated vineyards in both Sonoma and Napa Counties, and we help direct farming operations to assure that our grapes are produced using world-class growing techniques. We consistently produce remarkable wines with a hands-off natural winemaking style that showcases the character and personality of the individual vineyards.

Sojourn feels passionate about creating high-quality wines and always being accessible to the people who buy and enjoy our wines. Sojourn offers seated tastings in a casual, yet sophisticated environment and prides itself on always putting the customer first.

name: Spice Block Malbec
description:
This wine was beautifully crafted showing intense red colors and deep violet hues. Vivid aromas of ripe black fruit of blackberries, black cherry compote with a hint of
mocha tantalize the nose. The palate emphasizes great balance with robust flavors and supple tannins.

name: Sticks And Stones Red Blend
description: Made from selected grapes, this red blend is full bodied, with expressive fruit and a silky texture.

name: Terres De Galets Cotes Du Rhone
description: Deep purple red color. The wine has a full and intense character with aromas of red fruits and Provencal herbs and a hint of spicy black pepper and vanilla derived from oak aging. The spicy red fruit character is also evident on the palate which has a complex and lively structure.

name: Vadillo Reserva Rioja
description: Varietal aromas of red fruit and licorice that become more intense when you let the wine sit in the glass. The palate is fresh and lively with a rounded tannic structure that provides a fruity, balanced, persistent and tasty wine!

name: Val Prosecco Superiore Di Valdobbiadene
description:
There’s Prosecco, then there is Valdobbiadene! A little difficult to pronounce (val-doe-biah-den-ay!) but worth knowing more about.

Unfortunately, the original Prosecco zone has been expanded far beyond the original birthplace of one of the world’s most famous sparkling wines. Valdobbiadene is at the heart of this “classico” area where Prosecco wine began.

Val is from a third generation farm in the Val de Cune in the heart of old Valdobbiadene. The production is considerably smaller than most of their neighbors which is why you’ll only find Val Prosecco exclusively at Gary’s Wine & Marketplace.

Fresh citrus, stone, and orchard fruit explode from the wine with perfectly fresh acidity on the palate and a dry finish. Superbly pair-able with canapés and hors d’oeuvre, eggs benedict, rixi e bixi (risotto with pancetta and green peas), or cow’s milk cheeses like Bastardo Del Grappa.

name: Verquiere Plan De Dieu Cotes du Rhone Rouge
Wild Pig Pinot Noir
description: Bright ruby-red colour. Elegant and rich red fruits with strawberry flavours, notes of cherry on the finish and delicate tannins.

name: Wild Pig Viognier
description:
Pale gold colour with a bright green tint. Elegant and complex wine with dry apricots aromas. A well balanced and harmonious wine with a long finish.

Aromas of white peach and pear. In the mouth, peach and apricot notes. Superb as an aperitif, and wonderful with sweet-and-sour dishes with exotic fruit (mango, pineapple, guava, etc.)

name: Willakenzie Estate Pinot Blanc Yamhill Carlton
description: This 100% estate grown Pinot Blanc comes from a single block on the WillaKenzie Estate, including the original 1992 planting. Hand-picked clusters are fermented both stainless steel and neutral barrels to retain purity, but also enhance textural breadth and complexity. This dry Pinot Blanc is intense and complex, displaying aromas of citrus zest and lemongrass.

name: Zakin Estate Second Growth
varietal: Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot

name: Ziegler Cremant d'Alsace Brut Rose Reserve
14 Hands Cabernet Sauvignon
description: 14 Hands Cabernet Sauvignon is a bright, juicy red featuring aromas of blueberries and currants with subtle hints of dried herbs. Red berry flavors are complemented by a touch of spicy oak and accentuated by refined tannins.

name: 14 Hands Merlot
description: 14 Hands Merlot. This handsomely structured Merlot is packed with cherry and berry flavors. Round, soft and nuanced with oak, it's food-friendly and easy-drinking. Our vineyards were once home to wild horses that roamed the starkly beautiful hills and drank from the mighty Columbia River. 14 hands in height, these tough little horses were revered around the world. The terrain that gave them endurance and spirit, now feeds our wines. Our 14 Hands wines share the soul and intensity of this unbridled freedom. Alc. 13.5% by vol. Cellared & bottled by 14 Hands Winery, Paterson, WA.

name: 19 Crimes Red Blend
description: Our red blend bears the same traits as those banished to Australia. Defiant by nature, bold in character. Always uncompromising. It's a taste you'll never forget.

name: 19 Crimes Snoop Dogg Cali Red Blend
description:
Full and dense, with strong black & blue fruit notes up front from the Petite Sirah, complemented by bright red, slightly candied fruit in the background from the Zinfandel. The darkly toasted oak ties it all together along with a slightly sweet finish.

19 Crimes is defiant by nature, bold in character, and always uncompromising. We are proud to partner with entertainment icon, Snoop Dogg, who embodies all these qualities, and more, through hard work and perseverance. Snoop Dogg is a culture creator, innovator, and a leader in pop culture.

name: A To Z Pinot Noir
description: The garnet red, A to Z Oregon Pinot Noir showcases what A to Z does best. A vibrant, complex nose opens with floral, stone fruit and berry aromas - rose petal, violet, pomegranate, plum cherry, raspberry, black currant, boysenberry - that deepen with spice and wood notes - cinnamon, white pepper, thyme, vanilla, cedar, sandalwood, chocolate. Gentle oak aging adds definition supporting a delicious, harmonious balance between tannin, acid and fruit. The A to Z Oregon Pinot Noir is a prime example of the benefits of working with fruit grown in all of the remarkable valleys of Western Oregon.

name: A to Z Chardonnay
description: The delicately colored 2017 A to Z Oregon Chardonnay has a fresh, lively nose like fresh cut apples and distinct tropical notes (honeydew, kiwi, quince, kumquat, Meyer lemon, pineapple) and undertones of spring flowers, lemongrass and marjoram. The juicy, vibrant palate has a touch of minerality, something like wet stones drizzled with honey, and a natural fruit sweetness building length and presence. Tank aging on lees gives this wine a creamy texture and an interesting, broad mid-palate. Round and rich while maintaining tension and excitement, the impeccably balanced 2017 A to Z Chardonnay reflects another gorgeous Oregon vintage.

name: AIX Coteaux d'Aix en Provence Rose
description: Vivid orange-pink. Fresh and focused on the nose, displaying intense red berry and citrus fruit scents and a sexy floral overtone. Dry and nervy in style, offering sappy raspberry and blood orange flavors that flesh out steadily with air. Shows very good energy on the finish, which leaves lavender and dusty mineral notes behind.- Josh Raynolds

name: Abbazia Di Novacella Pinot Grigio
description: Pale straw yellow in color with an attractive aroma of citrus, peach and honeydew melon; medium to rich with orchard fruit flavors and tangy acidity on the finish. A short rest in oak brings a mouthfeel generally lacking in Pinot Grigio.

name: Aiola Chianti Classico
description:
Built as a 17th century fortress, the Aiola castle has undergone many transformations to become the prestigious winery it is today. In 1937 Giovanni Malagodi bought Aiola and started bottling Classic Chianti.
In 2012, with new owners, vineyards were replanted and the equipment was renovated and up-dated. Aiola lies at the heart of the Chianti Classico DOCG area. The vineyards are on lands of three distinct soil types, allowing for the creation of rich and sophisticated wines

name: Alma De Los Andes Malbec Reserva
description: The Alma de los Andes Malbec is a year round favorite!  It consistently over-delivers for the price point. This smooth, easy drinking wine is perfect for parties and pairs beautifully with an array of cuisines!

name: Alois Lageder Pinot Grigio
description:
This Pinot Grigio is a brilliant straw yellow with green shimmer. There are quite pronounced and expressive aromas of flowers with somewhat spicy notes. There is rich flavor in the mouth, with slight smokiness at the back and a good, fresh finish.
Pairs well with fish or meat starters, pates and terrines, fish and shellfish, poultry, white meat and mushrooms. Made with grapes from select vineyards in the Dolomiti area where the soil is primarily limestone. Fermentation in stainless steel tanks followed by four months on the lees. 

From Alois Lageder regarding their farming practices:
"We believe that organic and biodynamic cultivation greatly enriches the landscape. It nurtures the soil and creates a healthier and more diverse environment for flora, fauna, and for us humans. That is why we want to encourage our partners to make the full conversion to organic farming.

"To make this happen, we are drawing on our many years of experience with biodynamic agriculture. Together with our partners we are working on designating Terra Alpina wines as organic in just a few years, and we rely on their trust, advice, and support. The personal conviction of each individual partner is necessary to produce high-quality organic wines and to continuously improve their quality."

name: Alto Moncayo Veraton Garnacha
description: At once dark and fragrant with a ton of black fruit, but a ton more than that, too. This concentrated garnacha has a lot of drive and carries its tannic power with confidence. Long finish that is simultaneously bold and subtle. Drink or hold.- James Suckling JD 93 The 2015 Alto Moncayo Veraton is the entry level effort yet offers serious bang for the buck. Made from 100% Garnacha from vineyards in Tabuenca and aged in a mix of French and American oak, it gives up terrific notes of blackberries, currants, toasted spices and dried flowers. Possessing beautiful purity of fruit, a full, layered mid-palate, integrated oak, and a great finish, it’s a smoking good Grenache to enjoy over the coming 4-5 years.- Jeb Dunnuck

name: Amalaya Malbec
description: Richly colored and aromatic, with a touch of oak and supple, caressing tannins.

name: Apothic Crush Red Blend
description: Apothic Crush Red Blend is a decadent red wine blend with medium tannins and a velvety smooth finish. This luscious red blend features notes of ripe berries, raspberry jam and hints of caramel and chocolate with a long, smooth finish. This versatile red blend is ideal on its own, or for wherever the night takes you. Enjoy Apothic Crush at room temperature. Crafted with the signature wine grapes of California, Apothic Crush Red Blend wine offers a truly unique wine experience.

name: Apothic Inferno Bourbon Barrel Aged Red Blend
varietal: Zinfandel, Petit Verdot, Merlot, Syrah, Petite Sirah, Red Blend, Halloween
description: Apothic Inferno Red Blend is a bold, intriguing red blend aged for 60 days in charred whiskey barrels. This wine with a whiskey soul features notes of red and dark fruit, maple, and spice with a long, clean finish. This robust wine pairs well with gatherings or a roaring fire. This wine is best enjoyed at room temperature or in a whiskey-inspired wine cocktail. Apothic Inferno Red Blend offers a truly unique wine. Apothic has been a true original from the start, crafting bold wines with a hint of intrigue.

name: Apothic Red Blend
description: Apothic Red is the bold and intriguing red blend that launched the Apothic legacy, featuring a mix of merlot, cabernet sauvignon, syrah, and zinfandel wine grapes. This California wine indulges the senses with notes of black cherry, vanilla and mocha and a character all its own. This smooth and rich red blend is medium bodied and pairs with wherever the night may take you. Apothic Red is best enjoyed with plenty of wine glasses to share.

name: Apothic White Blend
description: Apothic White Blend Semi Sweet White Wine is a crisp, refreshing balance of Chardonnay, Riesling and Pinot Grigio that suits any occasion. This California white wine features the juicy fruit notes of peaches and apricot with a touch of sweetness and a floral aroma. Chardonnay wine delivers texture and body, while Pinot Grigio white wine provides a bright, balanced finish. This white wine blend is perfect for pairing with a variety of dishes, including spicy food. The vibrant wine features a screw top for quick opening and easy, secure storage. Chill this Apothic wine in the refrigerator before opening, as it's best served cold. This medium bodied white is a wine lover's favorite, offering a truly unique white wine bottle experience.

name: Argiolas Vermentino di Sardegna Costamolino
description: Vermentino often shows the fragrance of macchia, the mix of evergreen shrubs and herbs that typifies the Sardinian landscape. Costamolino hints at aromas of pine and mint coupled with ripe stone fruit and sweet citrus. The palate is at once vibrant and textural and finishes with lingering acidity.

name: Argyle Pinot Noir
description: Argyle Pinot Noir highlights the elegance and complexity of the Willamette Valley, showcasing the purity of fruit and supple texture the region has to offer. Fermented entirely in small, 1.5 ton lots and plunged by hand, the 2018 vintage leans dark cherry, red raspberry, and orange zest. Fresh, vibrant acidity is framed with polished tannin along with classic Argyle silky texture and persistent length.

name: Ariel Alcohol-Removed Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Less than 0.5% alcohol by volume. Rich in color and flavor, this oak-aged Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of blueberries, blackberries, black pepper and chocolate, with a hint of toasty oak, soft tannins and a dry finish.

name: Arnaldo Caprai Montefalco Rosso
description:
TASTING NOTES - Sensationally intense, with notes of wild flowers, violet and red berry jam. Full bodied, rich, dry with a long finish and delicate hint of spice.

PRODUCTION NOTES - 70% Sangiovese 15% Sagrantino 15% Merlot. Fermentation: 15 days in stainless-steel; indigenous yeast; 100% malolactic fermentation. Aging: 12 months in French oak barriques; minimum 6 months aging in bottle. Certified organic and biodynamic.

name: Arrowood Cabernet Sauvignon Monte Rosso
description: The 2012 Monte Rosso Cabernet is a layered and complex wine, exuding aromas of black cherry, dark chocolate, mocha and cigar box. The palate is firm and focused, structured by an acid backbone and iron-like minerality.

name: Au Bon Climat Chardonnay Santa Barbara County
Austin Hope Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Deep ruby in color, the 2018 Austin Hope Cabernet Sauvignon expresses aromas of fresh black currants and cherries accompanied by subtle smoky notes and dried spices. On the palate, this lavish powerful wine is layered with juicy blackberry, ripe cherry, vanilla bean and brown butter. It’s full-bodied and rich, balanced by a touch of bright acidity and firm polished tannins.

name: Aveleda Vinho Verde
description: Hints of white pulp fruits, such as apples and pears, come together harmoniously in the mouth, with a persistent fresh feel.

name: B R Cohn Sauvignon Blanc Silver Label
Banshee Mordecai 2016 Napa Valley Red Blend
description:
The very rough and unscientific formula is this: about a third Bordeaux varieties, about a third Rhone varieties, and about a third other varieties dominated by Zinfandel with a bit of of this or that peppered in to add interesting accent notes. Carignan sourced from a 45-year-old, organically farmed vineyard in Redwood Valley continues to expand its influence in Mordecai, acting as a bridge between the Rhone and Bordeaux lots.

The 2015 Mordecai has an enticing nose of pepper, violets, cigar and cassis. On the palate it is a mouthwatering mélange of red berry and plum flavors backed by earthy tones of herb roasted meat and fresh black trumpet giving way to a spice-laden finish.

name: Barefoot Hard Seltzer Variety 12 Pack
description: Barefoot Hard Seltzer, a premium alternative to beer and lighter-bodied alternative to wine. Made with three main ingredients Barefoot Wine, seltzer water, and natural flavor, each 250mL can boasts 70 calories, 2 grams of sugar, 4% ABV and is gluten-free. Barefoot Hard Seltzer delivers a hint of natural flavor and real wine in four vibrant and refreshing flavors – Pineapple & Passion Fruit, Cherry & Cranberry, Peach & Nectarine, and Strawberry & Guava.

name: Bartenura Moscato d'Asti
description: Crisp and refreshing. Semi-sweet with lingering pear, tangerine, nectar and melon flavors rounding out the finish. Perfect with dessert or fresh fruit, or for sipping poolside.

name: Beaulieu Vineyards BV Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon
Beckmen Vineyards Cuvee Le Bec
varietal: Grenache, Syrah, Mourvedre, Counoise, Red Blend
description: A Rhône varietal blend, ever evolving with watermelon, spicy-sweet red and dark fruits and touch of black licorice. Biodynamic and 100% hand farmed.

name: Benvolio Friuli Grave Pinot Grigio
description: This white wine is vibrant on the palate, the crisp acidity acts as the counterpoint to the peach, almond, and light floral notes in the wine.

name: Beringer Founders Estate Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Soft, round flavors and rich fruit characters are enhanced by oak undertones from aging in small French and American barrels. Accessible tannins provide structure and backbone to the vivid berry profile.

name: Beringer Founders Estate Pinot Noir
description: Beringer Founders' Estate honors the pioneering sense of discovery that brought founding brothers Jacob and Frederick Beringer to California. They had dreams of crafting fine wines, which led them to establish Beringer Vineyards in 1876. Today the Beringer Founders' Estate line of wines offer concentrated expressions of the most popular varietals, steeped in quality that comes from Beringer's history of crafting great wines from all over California for over 130 vintages.

name: Beringer Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
description: This Cabernet is set each vintage as a Bordeaux blend, with soft and silky tannins and a plush, full mouth-feel setting it up for immediate enjoyment, although it’s built to age and develop further complexity. Aromas of dried herbs, cedar, clove and lavender join flavors of dark red fruit led by figs, black cherry, currants, boysenberry, huckleberry, raspberry, and evident oak spice are joined with more traditional Knights Valley tones of black olive, wild sage and mocha chocolate. Fine acidity and balance with an elegant structure lead to a lingering, memorable finish.

name: Beringer Main & Vine Cabernet Sauvignon
description:
THE BASICS
Full of jammyblack fruit flavors that make this wine enticing from the first sip

THE TASTE
The sweet vanilla and richness of the oak flavors blend seamlessly into the wine, offering just a hint of spice.

THE SUMMARY
Easy-drinking and satisfying, this wine is well-suited to a variety of occasions.

name: Bethel Heights Aeolian Pinot Noir
description: Named for the wind that defines the EolaAmity Hills AVA, the Aeolian Pinot Noir is Bethel Heights' vehicle to explore the dynamic evolving landscape that we farm. The sense of place and specificity that they value most highly in their wines takes many years to evolve. With the oldest vines they allow each block to speak for itself in a separate bottling. The second generation vines at Bethel Heights, on the other hand, are just beginning to find their voice. In these years in between, the Aeolian allows us the freedom to dream of what lies beyond the horizon.

name: Bisol Jeio Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore brut
Black Box Cabernet Sauvignon
description:
Black Box Wines Cabernet Sauvignon is full-bodied, displaying enticing aromas of black currant, toasty oak, and a hint of vanilla. Ripe blackberries and chocolate fill the palate with balanced tannins that lead to a soft, lingering finish.
3.0L Box Size

name: Black Box Pinot Grigio
description: Black Box Wines Pinot Grigio expresses lovely aromas of pear and honeydew. As juicy flavors of citrus and apples lead to a finish that is bright and delicious.

name: Blackstone Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Our Cabernet Sauvignon shows vibrant blackberry and red cherry flavors with notes of cinnamon and toasted nuts.

name: Blufeld Medium Sweet Riesling
description: Inspired by the stunning blue slate soil of German vineyards, medium-sweet Blufeld combines citrus, peach and floral aromas, a juicy mid-palate and a crisp, refreshing finish. Pairs perfectly with spicy cuisine, sushi, salads or light appetizers.

name: Bodega El Esteco Malbec Valles Calchaquies Alta Argentina
Bodegas Juan Gil Jumilla
description: Grapes used to produce this wine come from old vineyards. Chalky and stony soils, poor in nutrients, are ideal for the growing of the Monastrell variety, with a low yield of about 2.500 kg/Ha. This wine has been kept for 12 months in French oak barrels.

name: Bogle Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Irresistible vanilla and intriguing black plums lay way to the dense and concentrated wine that is the Cabernet Sauvignon. Deeply extracted and complex dark fruit enhance the full-bodied character, and touches of toasted hazelnut and spicy clove are left by the 12 months of aging in one year old American oak. Ample tannins and an enduring finish will allow this wine to cellar for another 6-8 years, but don’t let anyone say you can’t enjoy it now

name: Bogle Chardonnay
description: Green apple and pear aromas classically characterize this wine as Clarksburg, while honeycomb and vanilla heighten the first impression. The rich, round entry rolls into a viscous and silky mouthfeel, surrounded by Asian pears and Honeycrisp apples. The finish lingers long and soft, like the wafting aromas of grandma’s warm apple pie.

name: Bogle Merlot
description: On the nose, notes of tea leaf, cherry cola and earth tones add richness and depth to the first impression of the wine. Bright cherry, red currant and ripe fig mingle with toasty herbal tones, all combining to create a silky and smooth mouthfeel. To perfectly compliment the fruit, the wine was aged in American oak for 12 months, creating firm tannins that balance the supple and lingering finish.

name: Bogle Phantom Red Blend
description:
Intriguing, beguiling…this mysterious apparition of ripe berry and relentless spice returns to haunt wine lovers. Enveloped in shadow, this wine’s intensity and concentration will entice you with every sip. Full-bodied and jammy, Phantom’s origins of Petite Sirah and Zinfandel emerge from the glass. Spicy pepper and juniper tantalize your senses, while black plums and blueberries emerge on the palate. Notes of pipe tobacco and clove settle around the finish, long and lingering, like the Delta fog.

Blend: 51.5% Petite Sirah, 48.5% Zinfandel

name: Bogle Vineyards Essential Red
description:
This compelling blend of Old Vine Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah has created a memorable and delicious wine. Aged in American oak barrels for 12 months, our Essential Red is easy to drink, but impossible to forget.

Tasting Notes
Barrel aged in American Oak for 12 months
Spicy Cedar
Black Plums

name: Bolla Cabernet Sauvignon
description: Ruby red in color. Bouquet of black fruit, vanilla, and clove, with a hint of spice. The wine is well balanced with a silky pepper and blackcurrant finish.

name: Bonterra Cabernet Sauvignon
description: This Cabernet offers aromas of bright cherry, currant and raspberry with notes of toasted oak and vanilla. In the glass, you will find flavors of cherry and currant and a lingering and thoughtful finish. Good structure, a moderate weight, polished tannins and balanced acidity.

name: Brancott  Estate Sauvignon Blanc
description:
Brancott wines are considered the benchmark of New Zealand wine-making as the winery was the first producer to plant Sauvignon Blanc in Marlborough to create the classic, world-renowned style. 

This Sauvignon Blanc presents a beautiful ripe fruit character reminiscent of citrus blossom and tropical fruit with crisp nettle highlights. Almost pungent in its intensity, it displays a spectrum of full fruit flavors from ripe tropical fruit to lush pink grapefruit. Pairs well with grill oysters, barbecued prawns or salmon, and poached white fish with fresh green salads containing parsley, pepper or lemon.

Double Gold - New York International Wine Competition (2017)

name: Bread & Butter Chardonnay
description: This Chardonnay opens with rich notes of vanilla bean and almond husk, reminiscent of a decadent crème brûlée.
